# Available Commands
The possible commands in Balatro are all composed of a single word specifying the action, followed by any necessary positional arguments, which are lists of integers.
Note: all position arguments are 1-indexed.

The following commands are available in your current game state.
use_consumable <consumeable_position> <target_card_position1> <target_card_position2> ... <target_card_positionN> - Use a consumeable from the consumeables section. The first position argument is the position within your consumables inventory of the consumable you'd like to use. Subsequent position arguments specify the cards in hand that the consumeable will be used on, if that consumeable requires targets.
sell_consumable <consumeable_position> - Sell a consumeable from the consumeables section.
rearrange_jokers <joker1> <joker2> ... <jokerN> - Rearrange the list of currently owned jokers. Every index in the list of current jokers must be present, i.e. if there are 5 jokers, the indices 1-5 must be present.
sell_joker <joker_position> - Sell a joker from the jokers section.
play <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Play the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may play up to 5 cards at a time. If you play a hand, you must also respond with the intended hand type you think you are playing, and an estimate of the number of chips you think you will earn from the hand. Use the results of previous hands played to inform your estimate.
discard <card1> <card2> ... <card5> - Discard the selected cards and draw new ones from the deck. You may discard up to 5 cards at a time.
rearrange_hand <card1> <card2> ... <cardN> - Rearrange the hand of cards. Every index in the list of current cards must be present, i.e. if there are 5 cards, the indices 1-5 must be present.

**Analyzing the Play: A Calculated High Card**

Okay, so I'm sitting on 4,401 chips, needing just 599 more. I've got three hands and discards left, and a modest $19 with interest capped at $15 (looking at the next level of $20). I'm carrying a "Death" and "The Chariot" consumable, and a strong hand with some intriguing Jokers: DNA, Brainstorm (currently irrelevant), a Blue Joker, Mail-In Rebate, and Ride the Bus.

The DNA/Brainstorm combo is out since this isn't the first hand of the round. The Blue Joker is providing a flat chip bonus of 106, Mail-In Rebate is adding a static +10 mult and $5 per three discards, and Ride the Bus is already at a sweet +12 multiplier, scaling on non-face cards. My current hand is a mix of high and low cards, including a Purple Seal wild card on the standard 10 of Diamonds.

My immediate goal: Secure the win while maximizing the Ride the Bus multiplier and managing resources. Since I only need 599 chips, I'll play conservatively for this hand, focusing on non-face cards to push that multiplier to +13 for the next round. I'm avoiding the face cards (Queen and King) to keep that Ride the Bus bonus climbing.

I'm considering the Purple Seal 10d (position 8), which I could discard for another Tarot card, but my consumable slots are full. I could use or sell a consumable to make room, but I don't really need to right now. The same goes for the Death card and Chariot.

Should I use "The Chariot" now to create a Steel Card from a high-value card (maybe the King or Queen) for late-game scaling? It could get me a x1.5 multiplier. However, I have plenty of chips already, so it's probably best to save it. Better to finish the round and save the consumables for the shop/boss.

Iâ€™m looking to play High Card. My current hand has the 10 of Diamonds (pos 7) and 9 of Clubs (pos 6). It doesn't matter which one I play, both are non-face cards. Playing the 10 of Diamonds is more chips.

Let's do the math: (Base Chips + Card Chips + Joker Chips) * (Base Mult + Joker Mult) = (45 + 10 + 106) * (5 + 10 + 12) = 161 * 27 = 4,347. This is way more than enough! Ride the Bus will go from +12 to +13 on the next round. The Mail-In Rebate will provide +10 mult and Ride the Bus gains another +1 mult.

I'm making a quick check: In the last turn, I discarded the 7 and 8 cards, which were 3d and Purple Seal, respectively. My hand at pos 6 is 9c, pos 7 is 10d, and pos 8 is Purple Seal. Playing the 10d from pos 7 will keep that Purple Seal for a discard on another turn.

The Blue Joker, which provided +108 chips previously is now only +106. Since the deck size has decreased by 1 card due to my current hand, it makes sense that the Blue Joker is +2 less.

Here's my final action: I'm playing the 10 of Diamonds from position 7. I'm going to have enough money to gain $5 interest.
